text: He is here and she is here.
translate: Él está aquí y ella está aquí.
desde el lunes hasta el domingo
El primer día es el lunes.
El segundo día es el martes.
El tercer día es el miércoles.
El cuarto día es el jueves.
El quinto día es el viernes.
El sexto día es el sábado.
El séptimo día es el domingo.

text: We only work for five days.
translate: Nosotros / nosotras sólo trabajamos cinco días.

text: I was at the cinema yesterday.

translate: Pedro es el novio de Marta.
Marta es la novia de Pedro.
Nosotros / nosotras estamos en la escuela.

text: We are having class / a lesson.

translate: Nosotros / nosotras queremos comprender a la gente.

text: We want to speak with people.
translate: Nosotros / nosotras queremos hablar con la gente.

text: Do you drink tea with lemon?
Do you drink coffee with sugar?
Do you drink water with ice?
People are drinking wine and beer.
translate: La gente bebe vino y cerveza.

text: Do you drink Coke with rum?

translate: Al bebé le gusta la leche. / El bebé gusta de la leche (am.).

text: The child likes cocoa and apple juice.
translate: Al niño / A la niña le gustan el cacao y el zumo de manzana.

text: The woman likes orange and grapefruit juice.
translate: A la mujer le gusta el zumo de naranja y el zumo de pomelo.

text: I have a kiwi and a melon.
translate: Yo tengo un kiwi y un melón.

text: I have an orange and a grapefruit.
translate: Yo tengo una naranja y un pomelo / una toronja (am.).

text: I have an apple and a mango.
translate: Yo tengo una manzana y un mango.

text: I have a banana and a pineapple.
translate: Yo tengo un plátano y una piña / una banana y un ananás (am.).

text: I am making a fruit salad.
translate: Yo estoy haciendo una ensalada de frutas.
Yo estoy comiendo una tostada / un pan tostado (am.).

text: I am eating toast with butter.
translate: Yo estoy comiendo una tostada / un pan tostado (am.) con mantequilla.

text: I am eating toast with butter and jam.
translate: Yo estoy comiendo una tostada / un pan tostado (am.) con mantequilla y mermelada.
Yo estoy comiendo un sandwich / emparedado (am.).

text: I am eating a sandwich with margarine.
translate: Yo estoy comiendo un sandwich / emparedado (am.) con margarina.

text: I am eating a sandwich with margarine and tomatoes.
translate: Yo estoy comiendo un sandwich / emparedado (am.) con margarina y tomate.
Nosotros / nosotras necesitamos pan y arroz.
Nosotros / nosotras necesitamos pescado y bistecs.
Nosotros / nosotras necesitamos pizza y espagueti.

text: We need carrots and tomatoes for the soup.
translate: Nosotros / nosotras necesitamos zanahorias y tomates para la sopa.

text: There is a garden behind the house.
translate: Detrás de la casa hay un jardín.

text: There is no street in front of the house.
translate: No hay ninguna calle frente a la casa.

text: There are trees next to the house.
translate: Hay árboles al lado de la casa.

text: The kitchen and bathroom are here.
translate: Aquí están la cocina y el baño.

text: The living room and bedroom are there.
translate: Ahí están la sala de estar y el dormitorio.
La puerta de la casa está cerrada.

text: We are going to the living room.
translate: Nosotros / nosotras vamos a la sala de estar.

text: There is a sofa and an armchair there.
translate: Hay un sofá y un sillón allí.
Mi equipo de sonido está allí.

text: The TV set is brand new.
Where do they like to go?
They like to listen to music.
translate: A ellos les gusta escuchar música.

text: Where do they not like to go?
They do not like to dance.
translate: A ellos no les gusta bailar.

text: We are cleaning the apartment today.
My husband is washing the car.
translate: Mi esposo lava el coche / carro (am.).

text: The children are cleaning the bicycles.
The children are cleaning up the children’s room.
translate: Los niños ordenan el cuarto de los niños.

text: My husband is tidying up his desk.
I am putting the laundry in the washing machine.
translate: Yo pongo la ropa en la lavadora.

text: I am hanging up the laundry.
Peter and Martha are from Berlin.
translate: Pedro y Marta son de Berlín.

text: Do both of you speak German?
Madrid and Berlin are also capital cities.
translate: Madrid y Berlín también son capitales.

text: Capital cities are big and noisy.
translate: Las capitales son grandes y ruidosas.
Canadá está en América del Norte.
Brasil está en América del Sur.

text: Are you here for the first time?
translate: ¿Es la primera vez que está (usted) aquí?

text: No, I was here once last year.
translate: No, ya estuve aquí el año pasado.

text: How do you like it here?
A lot. The people are nice.
translate: Sí, mucho. La gente es amable.

text: And I like the scenery, too.
translate: Y el paisaje también me gusta.

text: No, my wife / my husband is also here.
translate: No, mi esposa / mi marido ha venido conmigo.

text: And those are my two children.
translate: Y allí están mis dos hijos.

text: What would you like to drink?
Do you play a musical instrument?
I am currently reading this book.
translate: En este momento estoy leyendo este libro.

text: What do you like to read?
Do you like to go to concerts?
Do you like to go to the theatre / theater (am.)?
Do you like to go to the opera?
In which hotel are you staying?
translate: ¿En qué / cuál (am.) hotel se encuentra hospedado / -da (usted)?

text: How long have you been here for?
How long will you be staying?
Shall we see each other tomorrow?
I am sorry, but I already have plans.
translate: Lo siento, pero ya tengo otros planes.

text: Yes, and I also speak some Italian.
translate: Sí, y también yo sé hablar un poco de italiano.

text: I think you speak very well.
But speaking and writing is difficult.
translate: Pero es difícil hablarlos y escribirlos.

text: You only have a slight accent.
One can tell where you come from.
translate: Uno puede deducir de dónde viene (usted).

text: What is your mother tongue / native language (am.)?
Are you taking a language course?
I don’t remember the name right now.
translate: En este momento no sé cómo se llama.

text: The title is not coming to me.
translate: El título no me viene a la cabeza.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the snow? White.
translate: ¿De qué color es la nieve? Blanca.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the sun? Yellow.
translate: ¿De qué color es el sol? Amarillo.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the orange? Orange.
translate: ¿De qué color es la naranja? Naranja.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the cherry? Red.
translate: ¿De qué color es la cereza? Roja.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the sky? Blue.
translate: ¿De qué color es el cielo? Azul.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the grass? Green.
translate: ¿De qué color es la hierba? Verde.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the earth? Brown.
translate: ¿De qué color es la tierra? Marrón.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the cloud? Grey / Gray (am.).
translate: ¿De qué color es la nube? Gris.

text: What colour / color (am.) are the tyres / tires (am.)? Black.
translate: ¿De qué color son los neumáticos? Negro.

text: I would like to go to the station.
translate: Me gustaría ir a la estación.

text: I would like to go to the airport.
I would like to go to the city centre / center (am.).
translate: Me gustaría ir al centro de la ciudad.

text: How do I get to the station?
How do I get to the airport?
How do I get to the city centre / center (am.)?
translate: ¿Cómo se va al centro de la ciudad?
Yo necesito un plano de la ciudad.

text: I would like to rent a car.

translate: Aquí tiene mi tarjeta de crédito.
Aquí tiene mi permiso de conducir.

text: What is there to see in the city?
translate: ¿Qué hay para ver en la ciudad?
Vaya al casco antiguo de la ciudad.
Dé una vuelta por la ciudad.

text: Does it disturb you if I smoke?
Go on a harbour / harbor (am.) tour.
Are there any other places of interest?
translate: ¿Qué otros lugares de interés hay además de éstos?
Sí, por negocios la mayoría de las veces.
Pero ahora estamos aquí de vacaciones.
Sí, hoy hace realmente mucho calor.
Sí, nosotros / nosotras también estamos invitados / invitadas.

text: Do you have a vacant room?
What does the room cost per night?
I would like a room with a bathroom.
I would like a room with a shower.
Is there a fax machine here?
What time do you serve breakfast?
What time do you serve lunch?
translate: ¿A qué hora es el almuerzo / la comida?

text: What time do you serve dinner?
There is no telephone in the room.
translate: No hay teléfono en la habitación.

text: There is no TV in the room.
translate: No hay televisión en la habitación.
¿Has perdido el autobús? / ¿Te dejó el autobús (am.)?

text: I waited for you for half an hour.
Don’t you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?
Is there a youth hostel nearby?
Is there a boarding house / a bed and breakfast nearby?
Take an umbrella with you next time!
translate: ¡La próxima vez lleva un paraguas contigo!

text: I have the day off tomorrow.
I’m sorry, I can’t make it tomorrow.
translate: Lo siento, pero no podré mañana.

text: Do you already have plans for this weekend?
translate: ¿Ya tienes algún plan para este fin de semana?

text: Or do you already have an appointment?
I suggest that we meet on the weekend.
translate: (Yo) sugiero que nos encontremos durante el fin de semana.

text: Shall we go to the beach?
Shall we go to the mountains?
I will pick you up at the office.
I will pick you up at home.
I will pick you up at the bus stop.
translate: Te recojo en la parada de autobús.
Éstas son las estaciones del año:

text: We like to go for a walk in summer.
translate: En el verano nos gusta ir a pasear.

text: It snows or rains in winter.
translate: En el invierno nieva o llueve.

text: We like to stay home in winter.
translate: En el invierno nos gusta quedarnos en casa.

text: What is the weather like today?
I would like an ice cream with whipped cream.
I would like some fruit or cheese.
We would like to have breakfast.
We would like to have lunch.
We would like to have dinner.
What would you like for breakfast?
Some salt and pepper also, please.
translate: Tráigame más sal y pimienta, por favor.
Tráigame otro vaso de agua, por favor.

text: I’d like to book a flight to Athens.
translate: Querría hacer una reserva de avión para Atenas.
En la ventana y para no fumadores, por favor.

text: I would like to confirm my reservation.
I would like to cancel my reservation.
I would like to change my reservation.
When is the next flight to Rome?
translate: ¿Cuándo sale el próximo vuelo para Roma?

text: No, we have only one seat available.
translate: No, sólo queda una plaza libre.

text: When does a bus go to the city centre / center (am.)?
translate: ¿Cuándo sale el autobús que va al centro de la ciudad?

text: How much luggage can I take?
Is that the train to Berlin?
translate: ¿Es éste el tren que va a Berlín?

text: When does the train arrive in Berlin?
I think this is my seat.
translate: Creo que éste es mi asiento.

text: I think you’re sitting in my seat.
translate: Creo que (usted) está sentado en mi asiento.

text: The sleeper is at the end of the train.
translate: El coche-cama está al final del tren.

text: And where is the dining car? – At the front.
translate: ¿Y dónde está el vagón-restaurante? – Al principio.

text: Can I sleep in the middle?
Can I sleep at the top?
When will we get to the border?
How long does the journey to Berlin take?
Do you have something to read?
Can one get something to eat and to drink here?
translate: ¿Se puede comprar algo para comer y beber aquí?

text: Could you please wake me up at 7 o’clock?
translate: ¿Podría (usted) despertarme a las 7:00 de la mañana, por favor?
Un zumo de manzana, por favor.
Un zumo de tomate, por favor.

text: I’d like a glass of red wine.
translate: Me gustaría una copa de vino tinto.

text: I’d like a glass of white wine.
translate: Me gustaría una copa de vino blanco.

text: I’d like a bottle of champagne.
translate: Me gustaría una botella de champán.

text: I’d like something that won’t take much time.
translate: Querría algo que no tarde mucho.

text: Would you like that with rice?
Would you like that with pasta?
Would you like that with potatoes?
I would like the menu, please.

translate: Me gustaría un zumo de naranja.

text: I’d like a coffee with milk.
translate: Me gustaría un café con leche.

text: I’d like a tea with lemon.
I’d like a tea with milk.
Do you see the tower there?
Do you see the mountain there?
Do you see the village there?
Do you see the river there?
Do you see the bridge there?
Do you see the lake there?
I’d like chips / French fries (am.) with ketchup.
translate: Una ración de patatas fritas con ketchup.
Y tres raciones de salchichas con mostaza.

text: Do you also like to eat leek?
Do you also like to eat sauerkraut?
translate: ¿Le gusta también comer la col fermentada?

text: Do you also like to eat lentils?
Do you also like to eat carrots?
Do you also like to eat broccoli?
Do you also like to eat peppers?
When is the next train to Berlin?
translate: ¿Cuándo sale el próximo tren para Berlín?

text: When is the next train to Paris?
translate: ¿Cuándo sale el próximo tren para París?

text: When is the next train to London?
translate: ¿Cuándo sale el próximo tren para Londres?

text: When does the train for Warsaw leave?
translate: ¿A qué hora sale el tren que va a Varsovia?

text: When does the train for Stockholm leave?
translate: ¿A qué hora sale el tren que va a Estocolmo?

text: When does the train for Budapest leave?
translate: ¿A qué hora sale el tren que va a Budapest?

text: I’d like a ticket to Madrid.
I’d like a ticket to Prague.
I’d like a ticket to Bern.
When does the train arrive in Vienna?
translate: ¿A qué hora llega el tren a Viena?

text: When does the train arrive in Moscow?
translate: ¿A qué hora llega el tren a Moscú?

text: When does the train arrive in Amsterdam?
translate: ¿A qué hora llega el tren a Ámsterdam?

text: Do I have to change trains?
From which platform does the train leave?
Where is the next gas station?
I have a flat tyre / tire (am.).
Can you change the tyre / tire (am.)?
I need a few litres / liters (am.) of diesel.
translate: Necesito un par de litros de gasóleo.

text: I have no more petrol / gas (am.).
I’d like a one-way ticket to Brussels.
translate: Querría un billete sólo de ida a Bruselas.

text: I’d like a return ticket to Copenhagen.
translate: Querría un billete de ida y vuelta a Copenhague.

text: What does a berth in the sleeper cost?
translate: ¿Cuánto vale una plaza en el coche-cama?

text: Do you have a petrol can / jerry can / gas can (am.)?
Where can I make a call?
Do you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?

translate: Su permiso de conducir, por favor.
Su permiso de circulación, por favor.

text: Do you have a new kitchen?
What do you want to cook today?
Do you cook on an electric or a gas stove?
translate: ¿Cocinas en una cocina eléctrica o de gas?

text: Do you have a tin opener / can opener (am.)?
Do you have a bottle opener?
Are you cooking the soup in this pot?
translate: ¿Estas cocinando la sopa en esta olla?

text: Are you frying the fish in this pan?
translate: ¿Estás friendo el pescado en esta sartén?

text: Are you grilling the vegetables on this grill?
translate: ¿Estás asando los vegetales en esta parrilla?

text: Here are the knives, the forks and the spoons.
translate: Aquí están los cuchillos, los tenedores, y las cucharas.

text: Is there a good restaurant around here?
translate: ¿Dónde hay un buen restaurante por aquí?

text: Take a left at the corner.
translate: Gire (usted) a la izquierda en la esquina.

text: Then go straight for a while.
Here are the glasses, the plates and the napkins.
translate: Aquí están los vasos, los platos, y las servilletas.

text: Then go right for a hundred metres / meters (am.).
translate: Después vaya a la derecha por cien metros.

text: You can also take the bus.
You can also take the tram.
You can also follow me with your car.
translate: (Usted) también puede simplemente conducir / manejar (am.) detrás de mí.

text: How do I get to the football / soccer (am.) stadium?
translate: ¿Cómo hago para llegar al estadio de fútbol?

text: Where is the tourist information office?
Do you have a city map for me?
translate: ¿Tiene (usted) un plano de la ciudad para mí?

text: Drive until you reach the third traffic light.
translate: Conduzca / Maneje (am.) hasta que llegue al tercer semáforo.

text: Then turn into the first street on your right.
translate: Después tuerza en la primera calle a la derecha.

text: Then drive straight through the next intersection.
translate: Después conduzca / maneje (am.) recto pasando el próximo cruce.

text: Excuse me, how do I get to the airport?
translate: ¿Disculpe, cómo hago para llegar al aeropuerto?

text: It is best if you take the underground / subway (am.).
Simply get out at the last stop.
translate: Simplemente vaya hasta la última estación.

text: Can one reserve a room here?
translate: ¿Puedo hacer una reserva de hotel aquí?

text: I would like a guide who speaks German.
translate: Quisiera un guía que hable alemán.

text: I would like a guide who speaks Italian.
translate: Quisiera un guía que hable italiano.

text: I would like a guide who speaks French.
translate: Quisiera un guía que hable francés.

text: Is the market open on Sundays?
Is the fair open on Mondays?
Is the exhibition open on Tuesdays?
Is the zoo open on Wednesdays?
Is the museum open on Thursdays?
Is the gallery open on Fridays?
Does one have to pay an entrance fee?
How much is the entrance fee?
Is there a discount for groups?
Is there a discount for children?
Is there a discount for students?
We want to go to the cinema.
A good film is playing today.
How much are the admission tickets?
I want to sit at the back.
I want to sit at the front.
I want to sit in the middle.
But the book on which the film was based was better.
translate: Pero el libro en el que se basa la película era mejor.

text: Is it dangerous to hitchhike alone?
Is it dangerous to go for a walk at night?
translate: ¿Es peligroso ir a pasear de noche?

text: Is there a parking lot here?
How long can one park here?
translate: ¿Por cuánto tiempo podemos tener el coche aparcado aquí?

text: Do you take the ski lift to the top?
You have to pack our suitcase!
Don’t forget your traveller’s cheques / traveler’s checks (am.)!
Take some suntan lotion with you.
Take the sun hat with you.
Do you want to take a road map?
Do you want to take a travel guide?
Do you want to take an umbrella?
Remember to take pants, shirts and socks.
translate: Que no se te olviden los pantalones, las camisas, los calcetines.

text: Remember to take ties, belts and sports jackets.
translate: Que no se te olviden las corbatas, los cinturones, las americanas.

text: Remember to take pyjamas, nightgowns and t-shirts.
translate: Que no se te olviden los pijamas, los camisones y las camisetas.

text: You need shoes, sandals and boots.
You need handkerchiefs, soap and a nail clipper.
translate: (Tú) necesitas pañuelos, jabón y unas tijeras de manicura.

text: You need a comb, a toothbrush and toothpaste.
translate: (Tú) necesitas un peine, un cepillo de dientes y pasta de dientes.

text: What does it cost to go to the station?
What does it cost to go to the airport?

translate: Aquí a la derecha, por favor.

text: Please turn left at the corner.
translate: Allí, en la esquina, a la izquierda, por favor.

text: That is okay, please keep the change.
translate: Está bien así, quédese con el cambio.

text: I am a member of a sports club.
There is a football / soccer (am.) stadium in our city.
translate: Hay un estadio de fútbol en nuestra ciudad.

text: There is also a swimming pool with a sauna.
translate: También hay una piscina con sauna.

text: And there is a golf course.
translate: Y hay un campo de golf.

text: There is a football / soccer (am.) match on now.
translate: En este momento hay un partido de fútbol.

text: The German team is playing against the English one.
translate: El equipo alemán está jugando contra el inglés.

text: Shall we go to the swimming pool?
Do you have a bathing suit?
Can you jump in the water?

translate: ¿Dónde están las gafas / los lentes (am.) de natación?

text: I am getting out of the water now.
What’s playing at the theatre / theater (am.) this evening?
translate: ¿Qué hay esta noche en el teatro?

text: What’s playing at the cinema / movies (am.) this evening?
translate: ¿Qué ponen esta noche en el cine?

text: Are tickets for the theatre / theater (am.) still available?
Are tickets for the cinema / movies (am.) still available?
Are tickets for the football / soccer am. game still available?
translate: ¿Aún hay entradas para el partido de fútbol?

text: I want to sit in the back.
I want to sit somewhere in the middle.
I want to sit at the front.
Can you get me a ticket?
Is there a golf course nearby?
translate: ¿Hay algún campo de golf por aquí?

text: Is there a tennis court nearby?
translate: ¿Hay algún campo de tenis por aquí?

text: Is there an indoor swimming pool nearby?
Isn’t it dangerous to swim there?
Can one rent a sun umbrella / parasol here?
Can one rent a deck chair here?
Can one rent a boat here?
I would like to water ski.
We’re looking for a sports shop.
translate: Estamos buscando una tienda de deportes.

text: We’re looking for a butcher shop.
We’re looking for a pharmacy / drugstore (am.).
We want to buy a football.
translate: Es que querríamos comprar un balón de fútbol.

text: We’re looking for a sports shop to buy a football.
translate: Estamos buscando una tienda de deportes para comprar un balón de fútbol.

text: We’re looking for a butcher shop to buy salami.
translate: Estamos buscando una carnicería para comprar salami.

text: We’re looking for a drugstore to buy medicine.
translate: Estamos buscando una farmacia para comprar medicamentos.

text: I’m looking for a jeweller / jeweler (am.).
I’m looking for a photo equipment store.
translate: Estoy buscando una tienda de fotografía.

text: I actually plan to buy a ring.
translate: Es que quiero comprar un anillo.

text: I actually plan to buy a roll of film.
translate: Es que quiero comprar un carrete de fotos.

text: I actually plan to buy a cake.
translate: Es que quiero comprar una tarta.

text: I’m looking for a jeweler to buy a ring.
translate: Estoy buscando una joyería para comprar un anillo.

text: I’m looking for a photo shop to buy a roll of film.
translate: Estoy buscando una tienda de fotografía para comprar un carrete de fotos.

text: I’m looking for a confectionery to buy a cake.
translate: Estoy buscando una pastelería para comprar una tarta.

text: I want to buy a present.
A large one or a small one?
May I see this one, please?
Or is it made of plastic?
And the bag is really very reasonable.
translate: Y el bolso está realmente muy bien de precio.

text: Can I exchange it if needed?
I also have a video camera.
Where can I find a battery?
There is a café over there.
There is a restaurant over there.
Where are the gorillas and the zebras?
translate: ¿Dónde están los gorilas y las cebras?

text: Where are the tigers and the crocodiles?
What do you do for a living?
I work as a nurse part-time.
We will soon receive our pension.

translate: Y el seguro médico es caro.

text: What would you like to become some day?
I would like to become an engineer.
I want to go to college.
I am doing an internship abroad.
translate: (Yo) estoy haciendo una pasantía / unas prácticas en el extranjero.

text: We always go to the cafeteria at noon.
translate: Siempre vamos a la cantina al mediodía.

text: I am looking for a job.
I have already been unemployed for a year.
translate: Llevo un año ya sin trabajo.

text: There are too many unemployed people in this country.
translate: Hay demasiados desempleados en este país.

text: I want to go to the library.
I want to go to the bookstore.
I want to go to the newspaper stand.
I want to borrow a book.
I want to buy a book.
I want to buy a newspaper.
I want to go to the library to borrow a book.
translate: Quiero ir a la biblioteca para tomar prestado un libro.

text: I want to go to the bookstore to buy a book.
translate: Quiero ir a la librería para comprar un libro.

text: I want to go to the kiosk / newspaper stand to buy a newspaper.
translate: Quiero ir al quiosco para comprar un periódico.

text: I want to go to the optician.
I want to go to the supermarket.
I want to go to the bakery.
I want to buy some glasses.
I want to buy fruit and vegetables.
I want to buy rolls and bread.
Which bus goes to the city centre / center (am.)?
Which bus do I have to take?
I want to go to the optician to buy glasses.
translate: Quiero ir a la óptica para comprarme unas gafas.

text: I want to go to the supermarket to buy fruit and vegetables.
translate: Quiero ir al supermercado para comprar frutas y verduras.

text: I want to go to the baker to buy rolls and bread.
translate: Quiero ir a la panadería para comprar pan y panecillos.

text: Where do I have to change?
How much does a ticket cost?
How many stops are there before downtown / the city centre?
You have to get off here.
You have to get off at the back.
The next train is in 5 minutes.
translate: El próximo metro pasa dentro de 5 minutos.

text: The next tram is in 10 minutes.
translate: El próximo tranvía pasa dentro de 10 minutos.

text: The next bus is in 15 minutes.
translate: El próximo autobús pasa dentro de 15 minutos.
¿A qué hora pasa el último metro?
¿A qué hora pasa el último tranvía?
¿A qué hora pasa el último autobús?

text: How do you like the music?
A ticket? – No, I don’t have one.
Then you have to pay a fine.
translate: Pues tendrá (usted) que pagar una multa.

text: But the band plays very well.
translate: Pero el grupo toca muy bien.

text: No, this is the first time.
translate: No, ésta es la primera vez.
Yo nunca había estado aquí antes.
(Yo) tengo una cita con el doctor.

text: I have the appointment at ten o’clock.
translate: (Yo) tengo la cita a las diez (de la mañana).

text: Please take a seat in the waiting room.
translate: Por favor tome asiento en la sala de espera.

text: The doctor is on his way.
What insurance company do you belong to?
What can I do for you?

translate: Tengo dolor de cabeza a menudo.
A veces tengo dolor de estómago.

text: Lie down on the examining table.

translate: La presión arterial está en orden.

text: I will give you an injection.
translate: Le voy a prescribir una inyección.

text: I will give you some pills.
I am giving you a prescription for the pharmacy.
translate: Le doy una receta médica para la farmacia.

text: Where is the nearest post office?
translate: ¿Dónde está la oficina de correos más cercana?

text: We feel like. / We want to.
We don’t feel like. / We do’t want to.
Is the post office far from here?
translate: ¿Está muy lejos la oficina de correos más cercana?

text: Where is the nearest mail box?
I need a couple of stamps.
For a card and a letter.
translate: Para una postal y para una carta.

text: How much is the postage to America?
translate: Sí, ¿cuánto cuesta el franqueo para América?

text: Can I send it by air mail?
How long will it take to get there?
Where can I make a call?
Where is the nearest telephone booth?
translate: ¿Dónde está la cabina de teléfono más próxima?

text: Do you have a telephone directory?
The man is wearing a hat.
translate: El hombre tiene puesto un sombrero.
No se puede ver su cabello.

text: One cannot see the ears either.
translate: No se pueden ver sus orejas tampoco.

text: Do you know the area code for Austria?
translate: ¿Sabe (usted) cuál es el código para llamar a Austria?

text: One moment, I’ll look it up.
You have to dial a zero first!
One cannot see his back either.
translate: No se puede ver su espalda tampoco.

text: I am drawing the eyes and the mouth.
translate: Estoy dibujando los ojos y la boca.

text: The man is dancing and laughing.
translate: El hombre está bailando y riendo.

text: The man has a long nose.
translate: El hombre tiene una nariz larga.

text: He is carrying a cane in his hands.
translate: Él lleva un bastón en sus manos.

text: He is also wearing a scarf around his neck.
translate: (Él) también lleva una bufanda alrededor de su cuello.

text: It is winter and it is cold.
The man is made of snow.
translate: El hombre está hecho de nieve.

text: He is neither wearing pants nor a coat.
translate: (Él) no lleva ni pantalones ni abrigo / saco (am.).

text: But the man is not freezing.
translate: Pero el hombre no se congela.

text: Where is the football / soccer (am.) field?
My foot and hand also hurt.
translate: El pie y la mano me duelen también.

text: I have a car / an automobile.
I also have a jacket and a pair of jeans.
translate: (Yo) también tengo una chaqueta y unos pantalones vaqueros / blue jean (am.).

text: I have a knife, a fork and a spoon.
translate: (Yo) tengo un cuchillo, un tenedor, y una cuchara.

text: Where is the salt and pepper?
translate: ¿Dónde están la sal y la pimienta?

text: No, it costs only one hundred Euros.
Do you want some more soup?
But I already know a lot of people.
translate: Pero ya conozco a mucha gente.
No, me voy el fin de semana.

text: But I will be back on Sunday.

translate: ¿Tu hija ya es mayor de edad?

text: But she already has a boyfriend.
Do you know where his key is?
Do you know where his ticket is?
And her credit card is also gone.
translate: Y su tarjeta de crédito también.

text: Six months make half a year.
I want to make a call.
I want to send an email.
Is there a sheet of paper and a pen here?
translate: ¿Hay una hoja de papel y un bolígrafo aquí?

text: Would you like to go for a walk?
I want to relax a little.
I want to ask you something.
I want to ask you for something.
I want to treat you to something.
Or do you prefer a tea?
They want to make a call.
Do the students learn a lot?
Do you often ask the teacher questions?
No, I don’t ask him questions often.
translate: No, no le pregunto a menudo.

text: Yes, he is working right now.
What do you want to do?
Do you want to play football / soccer (am.)?
Do you want to visit friends?
I don’t want to arrive late.
I don’t want to go there.
I want to stay at home.
Do you want to stay here?
Do you want to eat here?
Do you want to sleep here?
Do you want to leave tomorrow?
Do you want to stay till tomorrow?
Do you want to pay the bill only tomorrow?
Do you want to go to the disco?
Do you want to go to the cinema?
Do you want to go to a café?
I would like to open an account.
I want to deposit money in my account.
translate: Querría ingresar dinero en mi cuenta.

text: I want to withdraw money from my account.
translate: Querría sacar dinero de mi cuenta.

text: I want to pick up the bank statements.
translate: Querría un extracto de mi cuenta.

text: I want to cash a traveller’s cheque / traveler’s check (am.).
translate: Querría hacer efectivo un cheque de viaje.

text: I’m expecting a transfer from Germany.
translate: Estoy esperando una transferencia proveniente de Alemania.
Éste es mi número de cuenta.

text: Could you please give me small notes / bills (am.)?
Is there a cashpoint / an ATM (am.)?
How much money can one withdraw?
Which credit cards can one use?
translate: ¿Qué tarjetas de crédito se pueden utilizar?

text: Are you already allowed to drive?
Are you already allowed to drink alcohol?
Are you already allowed to travel abroad alone?
May one pay by credit card?
translate: ¿Se puede pagar con tarjeta de crédito?

text: May one pay by cheque / check (am.)?
May one only pay in cash?
May I just make a call?
He is not allowed to sleep in the park.
translate: Él no puede dormir en el parque.

text: He is not allowed to sleep in the car.
translate: Él no puede dormir en el coche.

text: He is not allowed to sleep at the train station.
translate: Él no puede dormir en la estación.

text: I didn’t come because I was ill.
She didn’t come because she was tired.
He didn’t come because he wasn’t interested.
translate: No ha venido porque no tenía ganas.

text: We didn’t come because our car is damaged.
translate: No hemos venido porque nuestro coche está estropeado.
¿Por qué no ha venido la gente?

text: They didn’t come because they missed the train.
translate: No han venido porque han perdido el tren.

text: I didn’t come because I was not allowed to.
translate: No he ido porque no pude.

text: Where has he left his glasses?
The clock hangs on the wall.
translate: El reloj está colgado en la pared.

text: The children cannot find their parents.
translate: Los niños no encuentran a sus padres.

text: How was your trip, Mr. Miller?
Where is your wife, Mr. Miller?
How was your trip, Mrs. Smith?
translate: ¿Cómo ha sido su viaje, señora Herrero?

text: Where is your husband, Mrs. Smith?

translate: Un poco más corto, por favor.

text: The pictures are on the CD.
translate: Las fotos están en el CD / disco compacto.

text: The pictures are in the camera.
translate: Las fotos están en la cámara.

text: Can you clean the pants / trousers?
Do you have a match or a lighter?

text: We must go to school at once.
translate: (Nosotros /-as) debemos ir a la escuela enseguida.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: We must go to work at once.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: We must go to the doctor at once.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: You must wait for the bus.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: You must wait for the train.

chapter: to have to do something / must
text: You must wait for the taxi.
Why aren’t you eating the cake?
translate: ¿Por qué no se come (usted) el pastel?

text: I’m not eating it because I must lose weight.
translate: No me como el pastel porque debo adelgazar.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the beer?
translate: ¿Por qué no se toma (usted) la cerveza?

text: I’m not drinking it because I have to drive.
translate: No me la tomo porque aún tengo que conducir.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the coffee?
translate: ¿Por qué no te tomas el café (tú)?

text: I’m not drinking it because it is cold.
translate: No me lo tomo porque está frío.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the tea?
translate: ¿Por qué no te tomas el té?

text: I’m not drinking it because I don’t have any sugar.
translate: No me lo tomo porque no tengo azúcar.

text: Why aren’t you eating the soup?
translate: ¿Por qué no se toma (usted) la sopa?

text: I’m not eating it because I didn’t order it.
translate: No me la como porque no la he pedido.

text: Why don’t you eat the meat?
translate: ¿Por qué no se come (usted) la carne?

text: I’m not eating it because I am a vegetarian.
translate: No me la como porque soy vegetariano /-a.

text: I am wearing a blue dress.
I am wearing a red dress.
I am wearing a green dress.
An old lady lives at the top.
translate: Allí arriba vive una mujer vieja / mayor.

text: A fat lady lives at the top.
translate: Allí arriba vive una mujer gorda.
Allí abajo vive una mujer curiosa.

text: But the neighbours have naughty children.
translate: Pero los hijos de los vecinos son descarados.

text: He is staying in a hotel.
translate: Él se está alojando en un hotel.

text: He is staying in a cheap hotel.
translate: Él se está alojando en un hotel barato.

text: He is reading a boring novel.
She is watching an exciting movie.
translate: Ella está viendo una película interesante.
Nuestro abuelo es muy viejo / mayor.

text: 70 years ago he was still young.
A woman who weighs a hundred kilos is fat.
translate: Una mujer de 100 Kg. es gorda.

text: A man who weighs fifty kilos is thin.
translate: Un hombre de 50 Kg. es delgado.

text: No, I don’t understand them so well.
translate: No, no la entiendo muy bien.

text: She took a piece of chocolate.
translate: Ella cogió un trozo de chocolate.

text: He was disloyal, but she was loyal.
translate: Él era infiel, pero ella era fiel.

text: He was lazy, but she was hard-working.
translate: Él era un holgazán, pero ella era trabajadora.

text: He was poor, but she was rich.
translate: Él era pobre, pero ella era rica.

text: He had no money, only debts.
translate: Él no tenía dinero, sino deudas.

text: He had no luck, only bad luck.
translate: Él no tenía buena suerte, sino mala suerte.

text: He had no success, only failure.
translate: Él no tenía éxitos, sino fracasos.

text: He was not satisfied, but dissatisfied.
translate: Él no estaba satisfecho, sino insatisfecho.

text: He was not happy, but sad.
translate: Él no era feliz, sino infeliz.

text: He was not friendly, but unfriendly.
translate: Él no era simpático, sino antipático.

text: How did you pass the exam?
translate: ¿Con qué nota ha aprobado (usted) el examen?

text: How did you find the way?
With whom did you make an appointment?
With whom did you celebrate your birthday?
What did you come to know?
Did you have to call an ambulance?
Did you have to call the doctor?
Did you have to call the police?
Do you have the telephone number? I had it just now.
translate: ¿Tiene (usted) el número de teléfono? Hace un momento aún lo tenía.

text: Do you have the address? I had it just now.
translate: ¿Tiene (usted) la dirección? Hace un momento aún la tenía.

text: Do you have the city map? I had it just now.
translate: ¿Tiene (usted) el plano (de la ciudad)? Hace un momento aún lo tenía.

text: Did he come on time? He could not come on time.
translate: ¿(Él) llegó a tiempo? No pudo llegar a tiempo.

text: Did he find the way? He could not find the way.
translate: ¿Encontró el camino? No pudo encontrar el camino.

text: Did he understand you? He could not understand me.
Why could you not come on time?
translate: ¿Por qué no pudiste llegar a tiempo?

text: Why could you not find the way?
translate: ¿Por qué no pudiste encontrar el camino?

text: Why could you not understand him?
I could not come on time because there were no buses.
translate: No pude llegar a tiempo porque no pasaba ningún autobús.

text: I could not find the way because I had no city map.
translate: No pude encontrar el camino porque no tenía un plano.

text: I could not understand him because the music was so loud.
translate: No pude entenderlo porque la música estaba demasiado alta.

text: I had to take a taxi.
I had to buy a city map.
translate: Tuve que comprar un plano (de la ciudad).

text: I had to switch off the radio.

translate: He contestado a todas las preguntas.

text: I know that – I knew that.
I write that – I wrote that.
I hear that – I heard that.
I’ll get it – I got it.
translate: Lo cojo / tomo, agarro (am.). – Lo he cogido / tomado, agarrado (am.).

text: I’ll bring that – I brought that.
I’ll buy that – I bought that.
I expect that – I expected that.
I’ll explain that – I explained that.
I know that – I knew that.
I was talking on the phone all the time.
translate: He hablado por teléfono todo el rato.
Me he comido toda la comida.

text: I am not coming because the weather is so bad.
translate: No voy porque hace muy mal tiempo.

text: He isn’t coming because he isn’t invited.
translate: Él no viene porque no está invitado.

text: I am not coming because I have no time.
translate: No voy porque no tengo tiempo.

text: I am not staying because I still have to work.
translate: No me quedo porque aún tengo que trabajar.

text: I’m going because it is already late.
translate: Me voy porque ya es tarde.

text: My son did not want to play with the doll.
translate: Mi hijo no quería jugar con la muñeca.

text: My daughter did not want to play football / soccer (am.).
translate: Mi hija no quería jugar al fútbol.

text: My wife did not want to play chess with me.
translate: Mi esposa no quería jugar conmigo al ajedrez.

text: My children did not want to go for a walk.
translate: Mis hijos no querían dar un paseo.

text: They did not want to tidy the room.
They did not want to go to bed.
He was not allowed to eat ice cream.
translate: Él no podía / debía comer helados.

text: He was not allowed to eat chocolate.
He was not allowed to eat sweets.
I was allowed to make a wish.
I was allowed to buy myself a dress.
I was allowed to take a chocolate.
Were you allowed to smoke in the airplane?
Were you allowed to drink beer in the hospital?
Were you allowed to take the dog into the hotel?
translate: ¿Pudiste llevar al perro contigo al hotel?

text: During the holidays the children were allowed to remain outside late.
translate: Durante las vacaciones los niños podían estar afuera hasta tarde.

text: They were allowed to play in the yard for a long time.
translate: Ellos / ellas podían jugar durante mucho rato en el patio.

text: They were allowed to stay up late.
Which newspaper did you subscribe to?
Why did you become a teacher?
Why did you take a taxi?
translate: ¿Por qué ha cogido / tomado (am.) (usted) un taxi?

text: I don’t know if he loves me.
I don’t know if he’ll come back.
I don’t know if he’ll call me.
I wonder if he thinks about me.
translate: Me pregunto si piensa en mí.

text: I wonder if he has someone else.
translate: Me pregunto si tiene a otra.

text: Maybe he tells me the truth?
I doubt whether he really likes me.
I doubt whether he’ll write to me.
I doubt whether he’ll marry me.
You are so lazy – don’t be so lazy!
translate: Eres muy perezoso. – ¡No seas tan perezoso!

text: You sleep for so long – don’t sleep so late!
You come home so late – don’t come home so late!
translate: Llegas muy tarde. – ¡No llegues tan tarde!

text: You laugh so loudly – don’t laugh so loudly!
translate: Te ríes muy alto. – ¡No te rías tan alto!

text: You speak so softly – don’t speak so softly!
translate: Hablas muy bajo. – ¡No hables tan bajo!

text: You drink too much – don’t drink so much!
You smoke too much – don’t smoke so much!
You work too much – don’t work so much!
You drive too fast – don’t drive so fast!
translate: Vas muy deprisa. – ¡No vayas tan deprisa!
Espera a que pare de llover.

text: I’ll wait until my hair is dry.
translate: (Yo) espero a que se me seque el pelo.

text: I’ll wait until the film is over.
translate: Espero a que termine la película.

text: I’ll wait until the traffic light is green.
translate: Espero a que el semáforo esté verde.

text: When do you go on holiday?
Yes, before the summer holidays begin.
translate: Sí, antes de que empiecen las vacaciones de verano.

text: Repair the roof before the winter begins.
translate: Repara el tejado antes de que llegue el invierno.

text: Wash your hands before you sit at the table.
translate: Lávate las manos antes de sentarte a la mesa.

text: Close the window before you go out.
translate: Cierra la ventana antes de salir.

text: Yes, after the class is over.
translate: Sí, cuando se haya acabado la clase.

text: After he had an accident, he could not work anymore.
translate: Después de tener el accidente, ya no pudo volver a trabajar.

text: After he had lost his job, he went to America.
translate: Después de haber perdido el trabajo, se fue a América.

text: After he went to America, he became rich.
translate: Después de haberse ido a América, se hizo rico.

text: The journey was beautiful, but too tiring.
translate: El viaje fue, de hecho, bonito, pero demasiado agotador.

text: The train was on time, but too full.
translate: El tren pasó puntualmente, de hecho, pero iba demasiado lleno.

text: The hotel was comfortable, but too expensive.
translate: El hotel era, de hecho, confortable, pero demasiado caro.

text: He’ll take either the bus or the train.
translate: Él coge / toma (am.) el autobús o el tren.

text: He’ll come either this evening or tomorrow morning.
translate: Él viene o bien hoy por la noche o bien mañana por la mañana.

text: He’s going to stay either with us or in the hotel.
translate: Él se hospeda o en nuestra casa o en un hotel.

text: She speaks Spanish as well as English.
translate: Ella habla tanto español como inglés.

text: She has lived in Madrid as well as in London.
translate: Ella ha vivido tanto en Madrid como en Londres.

text: She knows Spain as well as England.
translate: Ella conoce tanto España como Inglaterra.

text: He is not only stupid, but also lazy.
translate: Él no sólo es tonto, sino también holgazán.

text: She is not only pretty, but also intelligent.
translate: Ella no sólo es guapa, sino también inteligente.

text: She speaks not only German, but also French.
translate: Ella no sólo habla alemán, sino también francés.

text: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.
translate: Yo no sé tocar ni el piano ni la guitarra.

text: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.
translate: Yo no sé bailar ni el vals ni la samba.

text: I like neither opera nor ballet.
translate: A mi no me gusta ni la ópera ni el ballet.

text: The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.
translate: Cuanto más rápido trabajes, más pronto terminarás.

text: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.
translate: Cuanto antes vengas, antes te podrás ir.

text: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
translate: Cuanto mayor se hace uno, más comodón se vuelve.

text: Perhaps the weather will get better tomorrow.
translate: Tal vez hará mejor tiempo mañana.

text: I hope that it gets better.
Do you know that for sure?
I think that it is old.

translate: Diría incluso que tiene muy buen aspecto.

text: The boss definitely has a girlfriend.
translate: Seguro que nuestro jefe tiene novia.

text: It is very possible that he has a girlfriend.
translate: Es muy posible que tenga novia.

text: Shall we go to the department store?
translate: ¿Vamos a los grandes almacenes / la tienda por departamento (am.)?

text: I want to do a lot of shopping.

translate: (Yo) necesito sobres y papel para carta.

text: I need a cupboard and a chest of drawers.
translate: (Yo) necesito un armario y una cómoda.

text: I need a desk and a bookshelf.
translate: (Yo) necesito un escritorio y una estantería.

text: I need a doll and a teddy bear.
translate: (Yo) necesito una muñeca y un oso de peluche.

text: I need a football and a chess board.
translate: (Yo) necesito un balón de fútbol y un juego de ajedrez.

text: I need a hammer and a pair of pliers.
translate: (Yo) necesito un martillo y unas tenazas.

text: I need a drill and a screwdriver.
translate: (Yo) necesito un taladro y un destornillador.

text: Where is the jewellery / jewelry (am.) department?
translate: ¿En dónde está el departamento de joyas?

text: I need a chain and a bracelet.
translate: (Yo) necesito una cadena y una pulsera.

text: I need a ring and earrings.
translate: (Yo) necesito un anillo y unos pendientes / aretes (am.).
la gata de mi amiga / novia
el perro de mi amigo / novio
Éste es el abrigo de mi compañero.
Éste es el coche de mi compañera.
Éste es el trabajo de mis compañeros.

text: The button from the shirt is gone.
translate: El botón de la camisa se ha caído.
La llave del garaje ha desaparecido.

text: The boss’ computer is not working.
translate: El ordenador del jefe está estropeado.
¿Quiénes son los padres de la niña?

text: How do I get to her parents’ house?
translate: ¿Cómo se va a la casa de sus padres?

text: The house is at the end of the road.
translate: La casa está al final de la calle.

text: What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
translate: ¿Cómo se llama la capital de Suiza?

text: What is the title of the book?
What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?
translate: ¿Cómo se llaman los hijos de los vecinos?
¿Cuándo son las vacaciones escolares de los niños?

text: What are the doctor’s consultation times?
translate: ¿Cuándo son las horas de consulta del doctor?

text: What time is the museum open?
translate: ¿Cuál es el horario de apertura del museo?

text: We had to water the flowers.
translate: (Nosotros / nosotras) Tuvimos que regar las plantas.

text: We had to clean the apartment.
We had to wash the dishes.
Did you have to pay the bill?
translate: ¿(Vosotros / vosotras) tuvisteis que pagar la cuenta?

text: Did you have to pay an entrance fee?
Did you have to pay a fine?
Who had to go home early?
translate: ¿Quién tuvo que irse pronto a casa?

text: Who had to take the train?
translate: ¿Quién tuvo que coger / tomar (am.) el tren?

text: We did not want to stay long.
translate: (Nosotros / nosotras) no queríamos quedarnos mucho rato.

text: We did not want to drink anything.
We did not want to disturb you.
I just wanted to make a call.
I just wanted to call a taxi.
Actually I wanted to drive home.
translate: Es que quería irme a casa.

text: I thought you wanted to call your wife.
translate: Pensaba que querías llamar a tu esposa.

text: I thought you wanted to call information.
translate: Pensaba que querías llamar a Información.

text: I thought you wanted to order a pizza.
translate: Pensaba que querías pedir una pizza.

text: I’m angry that you drink so much beer.
I’m angry that you come so late.
translate: Me molesta que vengas tan tarde.

text: I think he needs a doctor.
translate: (Yo) creo que (él) debería ir al médico.

text: I think he is sleeping now.
We hope that he marries our daughter.
translate: (Nosotros) esperamos que (él) se case con nuestra hija.

text: We hope that he has a lot of money.
We hope that he is a millionaire.
I heard that your wife had an accident.
translate: Me han dicho que tu esposa ha tenido un accidente.

text: I heard that she is in the hospital.
translate: Me han dicho que está en el hospital.

text: I heard that your car is completely wrecked.
translate: Me han dicho que tu coche está completamente destrozado.
Me alegro de que hayan venido (ustedes).

text: I’m happy that you are interested.
translate: Me alegro de que tengan (ustedes) interés.

text: I’m happy that you want to buy the house.
translate: Me alegro de que quieran (ustedes) comprar la casa.

text: I’m afraid the last bus has already gone.
translate: Me temo que el último autobús ya ha pasado.

text: I’m afraid we will have to take a taxi.
translate: Me temo que tendremos que coger / tomar (am.) un taxi.

text: I’m afraid I have no more money.
translate: Me temo que no llevo dinero.

text: Since when is she no longer working?
Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.
translate: Sí, no trabaja desde que se casó.

text: Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
translate: Desde que se casó, no trabaja.

text: Since they have met each other, they are happy.
translate: Desde que se conocen, son felices.

text: Since they have had children, they rarely go out.
translate: Desde que tienen niños, salen poco.

text: She watches TV while she irons.
She listens to music while she does her work.
translate: Escucha música mientras hace las tareas.

text: I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.
translate: (Yo) no veo nada, cuando no llevo gafas.

text: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.
translate: No entiendo nada, cuando la música está tan alta.

text: Have you already been to Berlin?
I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.
translate: No huelo nada, cuando estoy resfriado /-a.

text: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.
translate: Si llueve, cogeremos / tomaremos (am.) un taxi.

text: We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.
translate: Si nos toca la lotería, daremos la vuelta al mundo.

text: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.
translate: Si (él) no llega pronto, empezaremos a comer.

text: No, I don’t know anyone here.
translate: No, aquí no conozco a nadie.

text: a little longer – not much longer
Will you stay here a little longer?
No, I won’t stay here much longer.
translate: No, ya no me quedaré más tiempo.

text: Would you like to drink something else?
No, I don’t want anything else.
No, I haven’t eaten anything yet.
translate: No, todavía / aún no he comido nada.

text: I get up as soon as the alarm rings.
translate: (Yo) me levanto en cuanto suena el despertador.

text: I become tired as soon as I have to study.
translate: Me siento cansado /-a en cuanto tengo que estudiar.

text: I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
translate: Dejaré de trabajar en cuanto tenga 60 años.

text: Does anyone else want a coffee?
As soon as I have a moment.
He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
I’ll work as long as I can.
I’ll work as long as I am healthy.
translate: Trabajaré mientras esté bien de salud.

text: He lies in bed instead of working.
translate: (Él) está en la cama, en vez de trabajar.

text: She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.
translate: (Ella) lee el periódico, en lugar de cocinar.

text: He is at the bar instead of going home.
translate: (Él) está en el bar, en lugar de irse a casa.

text: As far as I know, he lives here.
translate: Por lo que yo sé, (él) vive aquí.

text: As far as I know, his wife is ill.
translate: Por lo que yo sé, su esposa está enferma.

text: As far as I know, he is unemployed.
translate: Por lo que yo sé, (él) no tiene trabajo.

text: I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: (Yo) me quedé dormido, si no, habría llegado a tiempo.

text: I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: (Yo) perdí el autobús, si no, habría llegado a tiempo.

text: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: No encontré el camino, si no, habría llegado a tiempo.

text: He fell asleep although the TV was on.
translate: Él se quedó dormido / se durmió, aunque el televisor estaba encendido.

text: He stayed a while although it was late.
translate: Él se quedó un rato más, aunque ya era tarde.

text: He didn’t come although we had made an appointment.
translate: Él no vino, aunque habíamos quedado.

text: The TV was on. Nevertheless, he fell asleep.
translate: El televisor estaba encendido. Sin embargo, se quedó dormido / se durmió.

text: It was already late. Nevertheless, he stayed a while.
translate: Ya era tarde. Sin embargo, se quedó un rato más.

text: We had made an appointment. Nevertheless, he didn’t come.
translate: Habíamos quedado. Sin embargo, no vino.

text: Although he has no license, he drives the car.
translate: Aunque (él) no tiene permiso de conducir, conduce.

text: Although the road is slippery, he drives so fast.
translate: Aunque la calle está resbaladiza, conduce muy deprisa.

text: Although he is drunk, he rides his bicycle.
translate: Aunque está borracho, va en bicicleta.

text: Despite having no licence / license (am.), he drives the car.
translate: No tiene permiso de conducir. Sin embargo, conduce.

text: Despite the road being slippery, he drives fast.
translate: La calle está resbaladiza. Sin embargo, conduce muy deprisa.

text: Despite being drunk, he rides the bike.
translate: Él está borracho. Sin embargo, va en bicicleta.

text: Although she went to college, she can’t find a job.
translate: Ella no encuentra trabajo, aunque ha estudiado.

text: Although she is in pain, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Ella no va al médico, aunque tiene dolores.

text: Although she has no money, she buys a car.
translate: Ella se compra un coche, aunque no tiene dinero.

text: She went to college. Nevertheless, she can’t find a job.
translate: Ella ha estudiado una carrera universitaria. Sin embargo, no encuentra trabajo.

text: She is in pain. Nevertheless, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Ella tiene dolores. Sin embargo, no va al médico.

text: She has no money. Nevertheless, she buys a car.
translate: Ella no tiene dinero. Sin embargo, se compra un coche.
